title: Virtual Member Lecture: THINKING OF YOU. I MEAN ME. I MEAN YOU.
title_display: Virtual Member Lecture: THINKING OF YOU. I MEAN ME. I MEAN YOU.
short_description: Robyn Farrell, exhibition co-curator and associate curator of Modern and Contemporary Art, discusses how artist Barbara Kruger combines images with provocative text to expose and undermine the power structures that contain and construct our daily lives. Farrell considers the underlying concepts of Kruger's work and the "anti-retrospective" approach to the exhibition THINKING OF YOU. I MEAN ME. I MEAN YOU.
list_description: Robyn Farrell, exhibition co-curator and associate curator of Modern and Contemporary Art, discusses how artist Barbara Kruger combines images with provocative text to expose and undermine the power structures that contain and construct our daily lives.
description:
Robyn Farrell, exhibition co-curator and associate curator of Modern and Contemporary Art, discusses how artist Barbara Kruger combines images with provocative text to expose and undermine the power structures that contain and construct our daily lives. Farrell considers the underlying concepts of Kruger's work and the "anti-retrospective" approach to the exhibition THINKING OF YOU. I MEAN ME. I MEAN YOU.

We recommend using a laptop or desktop computer and downloading the latest version of Zoom to enjoy this program. You can submit questions for the speakers in advance or during the program using the Google Form below.

If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu. 

This exhibition is organized by the Art Institute of Chicago, the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, and The Museum of Modern Art, New York.
